title: Line Follower
description: Classic line following competition where robots navigate through complex paths using sensors to follow a black line on white surface.
rules: The robot must be autonomous and wireless
The robot must fit inside a 25 cm x 25 cm x 25 cm box, 1kg weight limit
The robot must not use infrared light-reflecting materials on the outside
The robot must not produce magnetic interference for other robots
The robot must be able to move in all directions
The robot must follow a black line on the playing field

title: Sumo Bot
description: Robot sumo wrestling competition where autonomous bots battle to push opponents out of the ring using strategy and power.
rules: Robo : Max 30 × 30 cm ,5kg ,safe material,no weapons.
Match : 3 rounds (1-2 Mins each ), push the opponents out of the line to win.
Ring : 77- 154cm diameter, non- slip surface.
Control: wireless remote ; no sign interference
Fair Play : No jamming, no holding beyond 5 sec, no unfair play

title: Paper Presentation
description: Present innovative research papers on robotics, automation, and emerging technologies in front of expert judges.
rules: Present original research with proper citations to uphold academic integrity
Deliver your presentation within the designated time frame (typically 10–15 minutes including Q&A)
Follow the prescribed format and guidelines provided by the organizers
Use clear and professional visual aids to effectively support your content
Ensure that no external assistance or mid-presentation modifications are involved

title: Robo Race
description: High-speed robot racing competition where autonomous robots navigate through challenging obstacle courses and tracks.
rules: Robo : Max 30 × 30 cm, 5 kg, safe material; design optimized for speed with no hazardous modifications.
Race : Timed rounds (1–2 mins each, best time wins); multiple heats may be used to determine finalists.
Control : Wireless remote; no signal interference or unauthorized adjustments during the race.
Fair Play : No track sabotage, no external assistance, and no mid-race modifications strict adherence to safety and sportsmanship is required.

title: Project Expo
description: Showcase innovative robotics and automation projects with live demonstrations and interactive exhibits.
rules: Exhibit an original project with comprehensive documentation that clearly explains your concept and methodology
Set up your display according to the provided guidelines to maintain safety and accessibility
Incorporate a live demonstration or interactive element to showcase your project's functionality
Adhere to your allocated time slot for the demonstration to ensure fairness for all participants
Avoid any unauthorized modifications or external assistance during the expo

title: Robo Soccer
description: Exciting robot soccer matches where teams of autonomous robots compete in strategic gameplay and ball control.
rules: Robo : Max 30 x 30 cm, 5kg, safe material, ball-striking mechanism permitted; no additional offensive attachments.
Match : Best 2 out of 3 rounds (2-3 mins each), score more goals than opponent to win.
Control : Wireless remote; no signal jamming or unauthorized interference.
Fair Play : No physical obstruction, no holding beyond 5 sec

title: From Theory to Practice
description: Bridge the gap between theoretical knowledge and practical implementation in robotics and automation systems.
rules: Theory to practical demonstration
Concept explanation required
Working prototype needed
Maximum 4 members per team
15 minutes presentation time

title: Technical Quiz
description: Test your technical knowledge in robotics, automation, AI, and emerging technologies through challenging quiz rounds.
rules: Multiple rounds of questions
Individual and team rounds
No external help allowed
Time-bound answers
Elimination format

title: Workshop (PLC/ROS)
description: Hands-on workshop on Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) and Robot Operating System (ROS) for industrial automation.
rules: Participants must review and complete all preparatory materials on PLC fundamentals before attending the workshop
All safety protocols and operational guidelines provided by the facilitators must be followed without exception
Each programming task and exercise should be completed independently, with proper documentation maintained throughout
Participants are required to stick to the allotted time slots for each session to help maintain an organized workshop schedule
Every participant must bring their own laptop with the necessary PLC simulation software pre-installed, as detailed in the workshop prerequisites

title: Connections
description: Interactive networking event connecting students, industry professionals, and robotics enthusiasts.
rules: Interactive networking format
Speed networking sessions
Industry mentor interactions
Career guidance sessions
Open discussion forums

title: E-Sports (Free Fire, Stumble Guys)
description: Gaming tournament featuring popular mobile games Free Fire and Stumble Guys with exciting competitions.
rules: Mobile gaming tournament
Free Fire and Stumble Guys competitions
Fair play policy enforced
Device checks before matches
Tournament bracket format

title: CID
description: Crime Investigation Department - A mystery solving competition combining technical skills with detective work.
rules: Team-based mystery solving
Technical clues and challenges
Time-bound investigation
Maximum 4 members per team
Multi-stage elimination rounds
